body.para: and what is the solution ? I have to use the html:checkbox ?
As of February 12th, 2003 Thomson unifies its email addresses on a worldwide basis. Please note my new email address: sandra.heligon@thomson.net

quote.quotepara: ----Original Message----- From: Jaye Bass [mailto:jayebass@knology.net] Sent: 09 April 2003 17:06 To: Struts Users Mailing List Subject: Re: HELP!: html:multibox and BeanUtils.getArrayProperty
The multibox only returns the items that are selected.
But the problem is that the length of the selected array is not the same one as the length of the employees array. The employees array is the second property of the form.
Why the table selected only contains the items that have been checked ? and not all ?
As of February 12th, 2003 Thomson unifies its email addresses on a worldwide basis. Please note my new email address: sandra.heligon@thomson.net
----Original Message----- From: John Greenhill [mailto:jgreenhill@dayspring-tech.com] Sent: 08 April 2003 22:48 To: Struts Users Mailing List Subject: RE: HELP!: html:multibox reset button
We've done what you want with javascript, i.e.
Then you can have your button execute the script.
-john

-----Original Message----- From: Heligon Sandra [mailto:sandra.heligon@thomson.net] Sent: Tuesday, April 08, 2003 12:49 AM To: 'struts-user@jakarta.apache.org' Subject: HELP!: html:multibox reset button Importance: High
I would like to do the same thing as in the test html:multibox example.

I have a list of check-boxes and I would like to implement a button Reset that allows to uncheck all the check-boxes. I read in previous messages that we have to implement the reset() method but I don't have any class I use a DynaValidatorForm.
My DynavalidatorForm:

<form-bean name="myForm" dynamic="true" type="org.apache.struts.validator.DynaValidatorForm"> <form-property name="employees" type="java.util.ArrayList" /> <form-property name="selected" type="java.lang.String[]" /> </form-bean>
My JSP page:
d√©fintion of the reset button ?

I will also wish to make the opposite function, have a button to check all check boxes. I posted many messages on this subject but nobody never answered me I hope that somebody will be sensitive to my call because I already lost much time on this subject. Thanks a lot in advance
As of February 12th, 2003 Thomson unifies its email addresses on a worldwide basis. Please note my new email address: sandra.heligon@thomson.net
